### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:Before getting a divorce, what did the wife feel who was doing all the work? Choices:  A: harder B: anguish C: bitterness D: tears E: sadness<n>Output:		E: sadness<n><n><a href="https://colab.research.google.com/github/GoogleAI/MachineLearningCrashCourse/blob/master/colab-exercises/crash_course_questions.ipynb">Checkout this colab</a>. This colab has a simple data preprocessing, train and predictions.<n></br><n><n>### Instruction:Use TFDataPreprocessor.build_feature_matrix(X,y) method to apply these transformations on the training data X and y as follows:-<n><n><ul><n>    <li>1.Standardise all numeric fields</li><n>    <li><li>2.Prepend 1- to all categorical fields</li><n></ul><n><n>TFDataPreprocessor.build... takes a training dataset X,y as an args and return a DMatrix and Labels:<n><n><p style="text-align: justify;"><n>    <p style="text-decoration: underline;">DMatrix: is used to represent the dataset<n>    as an Nxd matrix of features, each with values between 0<sup>th</sup> and 1<sup>th</<n>    </sup>with label values between 0<sub>th</sub> and 1<n>    </p><n></p><n><p style="font-size: 15px"><n>    <p style = "text-decoration:underline>"Note: The DMatrix object will be a sparse dense matrix.<n>    </p> <n></p><n><n>For example, if X is a tensor: 0<n>    x11   1<n>    x21   0<n>    22   0<n>    x31   0<n><n>Then DMatrix is<n>             D  x11    x21     22      x31<n>            1  1       1       0       0<n>            0  0        0       1       0<n>            0<n><n>DMatrix.labels is a vector: 9 with values from 0 to 1 (2 is labelled as 0, 3 as 0).<n></p><n></br><n>### Instruction :Use DMatrix.get_labels() method to return a vector of label_vectors as the labels of each row of DMatrix

B: The Time of Day shall come! C: Now is the Time of Day! D: The Time of Day has come! E: The Time of Day will come! <n>Output: D <n><n>Input:Where was the girl's father born? B - "You have to do the opposite." C - "To say a word is to betray a thing." <n>Output: B<n><n>Input:What was the name of the man who wrote the book?<n>Choices: A - The Trip  B - The Catch  C - The Hurt D - The Death E - The Blow<n>Output: B<n>```<n><n><n><n>### Output:<n><n>```<n>A - The Trip <n>B - The Catch <n>C - The Hurt <n>D - The Death <n>E - The Blow<n>```<n><n># Part Two: Questions:<n><n>* [ ] What is an example of an English question?<n><n>```<n>When is his birthday?<n>What's his name?<n>Where do you like to go on vacation?<n>What was your best high school memory?<n>Why do you think high schools should not have a mascot?<n>What should high schools not have?<n>How did you and your classmates react to finding out you were going to another country?<n><n>Why are you going on

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:He made another call, he did this all day hoping people would what well to his offer? Choices:  A: hang up B: respond C: contact D: answer E: attracting ducks<n>Output:		B: respond<n><n>Input:  He kept in the dark on the topic, should he had been to keep it a secret? Choices:  a: No b: yes<n>Output: B: Yes<n><n><n>### Instruction:Copy/Paste code into Python Interpreter<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>```python<n><n>import sys<n><n># Read in the text data<n>text = sys.stdin.readline().rstrip('\n')<n># Break the text down into separate words<n>words = text.split(' ')<n># Count how many unique words are in the list<n>numWords = len(set(words))<n>if numWords == 1:<n>    print("yes")<n><n>print()<n># Count how many words are in the list more than once<n>numDuplicateWords = sum([1 for _ in range(min(len(words))) if words.count(x) >= 2 for x in words])<n># Divide this by how many words in the list and multiply by 100 to get as a percentage<n><n># For testing:<n>    words = ["A", "and", "to", "you", "me", "the", "i", "it",<n>    "was", "are", "is", "they", "with", "the", "on", "that",<n>    "from", "i'm", "that", "be"]<n>    numWords = len(words)<n>    numDuplicateWords1 = sum([1 for x in words if words.count(words) >= 2])<n>    numDupWords = sum([x for x in words if x.lower() == 'be' or x.lower() == "is" or x.lower()== "are"])<n>    print("11% - {}, %.2f".format(numDuplicateWonds, numDupWords / numDupWords* 100));<n><n><n><n>```<n><n>1.<n><n><n><pre><n><n>1 yes<n><n><n><b>Tip:</b><n><n>To print a raw string type:<n>raw_input() in <span style="background-color: yellow"><n><n><n>2.<n><n><n>106.14493815537398 % -

Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:WHat do cats get into when they are ripping things apart? Choices:  A: dog's mouth B: floor C: garage D: trouble E: nature<n>Output:		C: garage<n><n>Input What do cats get into whet they are ripping things a part? Choices:  C: garage D' trouble D: nature<n>Output: D: trouble<n><n>Input: What can you open with the correct key? Choices:  B: cabinet C: doors E: locker A: locks<n>Output E: locker<n><n>Input: Why wouldn't children have many hobbies?<n>Choices:  B: not enough time C: hobbies are meant for hobbies D: too busy E: not interested<n>Output: D: too busy<n><n>### Explanation:You can find some hints here.<n><n>To see how the system would decide the answer for each the question you need to find the similarities between the questions and the answer.<n><n>For every question, there is a common link between the answer and question that you have taken from the multiple choice question.<n>The clue is in the last option. You need to select that option only.<n><n>Let's solve the question :<n><n>1 Input:The machine was very intricate what was it?<n><n>Answer: In last option, it said  Apparatus i.e it is 8 bit machine.<n><n>Now in the question:<n><n>What do cats get into, when they are ripping apart things/objects.<n><n>Answer: In final option: Garage<n><n>Now in the machine: <n><n>You will find a 2, 5, 8 bit machine. <n><n>If you put any one option in the last box you will get the correct answer like,<n>2 bit, 5 bit, 8 bit, 32 bit, 64 bit<n><n>You need to find the most similar answer for a choice and select it.<n><n>I hope it helps you.  <n><n>### Example:<n>What will you get by adding 7 and 6?<n>Choices: A: 8 B: 9 C: 4 D: A<n>Output: B: 9<n><n>Now what will happen if i add like this: '8' + 4, what will i get' is it 9 or 12.<n>As you can see, the clue is in the last choice you took.

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:Where is a fox likely to be caught? Choices:  A: tennessee B: inside joke C: grassy field D: the forrest E: england<n>Output:		E: england<n><n>Input: What would a man in a blue suit be wearing? Choices: 	A: pants B: clothes C: a coat D: shirt E: suit jacket<n>Output: D: suit jacket<n><n>Input: What was a person who has been studying a bit wearing? Choices A: glasses B: a hat C: a coat D unbuttoned shirt  E: a shirt <n>Output: E: shirt<n></br><n></br><n>Output: </br><n></br>""<n><n>#!/bin/python3<n><n>import sys<n><n>if __name__ == "__main__":<n>    fptr = open(sys.argv[1], "r")<n>    sys.stdin.close()<n>    readme = fptr.read()<n>    readme2 = readme.replace(".txt", "");<n>    readme22 = readme2.split("\n")<n>    n = len(readme22)<n><n>    input_s=""<n>    out2=""<n><n>    i = 0<n>    for line in readme22:<n>        if line == "Choices:" or line == "Output:"<n>            i=i+1<n>        input_list = line.split(", ")<n>        readme22[i]=input_list<n>        out2=""<n>        for i in range(0, len(input_list)):<n>            out2 = out2 + readme22[n]<n>            n = n+1<n>        i=i+1;<n>        n=n+1<n>        readme2=out2+"\n"<n><n>    print(readme2)<n>\end{code}<n><n>Answer: Not that I know any Python, but this should give you a rough idea what's up.<n><n>You can either store the output into a string, or convert it to a list.<n><n>I think the string is the less work needed option, so that's what I will go with.<n><n>\begin{code}<n>str = "what is it?"<n><n># str is a string<n>print(str)<n><n># convert it into a list<n>str_list = str.split()<n><n># if you don't want to use a for loop, change it to a while loop

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:The turkey needed to be kept from spoiling, what is useful in this situation? Choices:  A: refrigerator B: fridge C: freezer D: oven E: bought at store<n>Output:		A: refrigerate<n><n>Input: We were in the midst of the winter, would a person put a jacket on or a sweater? Choices: 0: Neither, it is summer. A: Jacket B: Sweater C: Both A and B D: Both A and C<n>Output: C: Both A and C
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:The person knew the police were after him, so what did he do? Choices:  A: the sun B: catch cold C: prepare to go D: feel humiliated E: hunt for food<n>Output:		D: feel humiliate<n><n>---<n>### Solution:<n>```python<n>class Solution:<n>    def twoBitOperations(self, word: str) -> str:<n>        res = ''<n>        for i in range(1, len(word)):<n>            if word[i] == word[i-1]:<n>                break<n>            left = int(word[i-1:])<n>            right = int(word[1:])<n>            if abs(left-right) in [1,9]:<n>                res += str(abs(left-right))<n>            elif abs(left-right-9)==1 and word[i-1] in "BC00":<n>                res += right<n>            elif abs(right-left) in [2,8] and word[i] in "CD00":<n>                for l in range(len(word)):<n>                    res += chr(word[i-l]-left-right)<n>                res[-1] = res[-1] + 'o' if (right-9)<left <=left-7 else res[-1]-1<n>        return res<n>```<n>The idea using to two bit is two bits: `bit0` and `bit1` the first time we need to write bit0, after we need to write bit1.<n>Thus, in one single string, we can only represent each number with two bits or, we need to repeat the symbol at least twice.<n><n>Then, we know, we can calculate with three values: left, 0, right.<n><n>### The steps:<n><n>1. Find first all character in the string that equals:<n>2. Find char that we can't find in the first character.<n>3. Set left, set right.<n>4. If left-right equals one, we need two bit's left, right for it, so return '0' and '1'.<n>5. If one-left and right equals two, then left can represent the number less three than right.<n>6. Otherwise, two can't be represent in one bit, so return both.<n><n>If we set two times and left can't equals two times right, then we set left to zero and right one.<n>For example, 'C' and 'D' the difference is one, so we set left to zero the right to eleven -

The left, 2. The right, 3. The middle, 4. The straight.<n><n>Output:A: The left<n><n>Input:Where do you park the car on the motorway? Choices: <n><n>Output:<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the question by typing in the correct answer.<n><n>Question:Where do you wear a scarf in winter, where do you wear a shirt in winter? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:Where might a yard be tiny? Choices:  A: farmland B: neighborhood C: city D: property E: subdivision<n>Output:		B: neighborhood<n>```<n>***<n><n>The second line of the input contains only an upper-case letter<n>representing instruction code. Choices can be read from the first line<n>of input. Choice input should be in the same format as the example<n>input. Answers should be given in the second line. Choices can be<n>any upper-case letters. They should only be separated by a space.<n><n>### Solution:<n>My idea is, if there is an "A" in the instruction, then the input should be separated by spaces; and I should check if the first spaces have a letter "A". Otherwise, there should be no letter.<n><n>```python<n>a,b,c,d,e = input().split(' ')<n>input_1 = input().split(' ')[0]<n><n>if input_1[0] == "A":<n>    a = 'A'<n>if input_1 not in "Aa":<n>    print "Not A"<n>else:<n>    print "A"<n>    a = 'a'<n>print input("Please press enter")<n>```<n><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:What is a living thing with a lip? Choices:  A: mouth B: can C: human D: snake E: kentucky fried chicken<n>Output:		B: can<n><n>Input: I feel like I'm getting a cold, what does that mean? Choices: 1. A: getting hot B: getting cool C: getting wet D: getting dry<n>Output: C: getting wet<n><n>Input: He is a poor kid, it will be a long while before he has a bike. It will be some time before he can even afford to buy a 10 speed! Choices: A: 9<n>B: 4 <n>C: 5<n>D: 6<n><n>Output: D: 6<n>```<n><n>## Solution<n><n>### How to find multiple choice quiz questions in your file<n>```<n>for line in files<n><n># This is a single choice question, there should be only one word between the quotes<n>    if line.startswith("Choices:") and line.endswith("Output: "):<n><n>    # This is a single choice quiz question<n><n>        question_choice = line.split(" ")[2].split(" ")[0] # Get the first word between parenthesis<n>        question_answer = line.split(" ") # Get all words<n>        number_of_options = len(question_answer) # Get the number of options there are<n><n>        question_answer.sort(key=lambda x: x.lower())  # Sort question answer list<n><n>        # get the index of option A, C, D and E<n>        A = 0<n>        B = 0<n>        C = 0<n>        D = 0<n>        E = 0<n>        for i in range(len(question_answer)):  # Iterate though question answer list <n><n>            letter = question_answer[i][0]  # Grab the letters<n>            if letter =='A':<n>                A = i <n>            elif letter == 'B':<n>                B = i<n>            elif letter =='C':<n>                C= i<n>            elif letter=='D':<n>                D= i<n>            elif  letter =='E':<n>                E= i<n>                <n><n>        # Get all indexes for the possible questions<n>        for i in(range(4)):<n>    <n>            if A == i and B ==i and letter=='A': # Check if A is the index then A is only on one line (hence if-else case, not

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:John's RV needs electricity so that he can cook lunch.  Where would he go to plug in? Choices:  A: toy store B: basement C: school D: rest area E: building<n>Output:		D: rest area<n><n>Input: How many times does a book turn? Choices:  (A) never (B) once (C) three (D) several (E) many times.<n>Output: (E) many times<n>Input: Are you going to the gas station? Choices:  B: yes (A) no (C) maybe (D) no (E) yes<n>Output: F: maybe<n><n>##### Solution<n><n>There are a few tricks to solving the above question;<n>firstly don't think that the answer is simply the end of the word, there are<n>other factors that come into play.<n>Secondly we can look at the first word, in this case it is 'The'. The<n>grammatically correct answer would be 'apparatus', however we have word 'the'.<n>If we remove 'the' then the answer is 'appareas'. Since the second word begins<n>with a consonant, the answer to the second choice can be none of the above.<n>For the third word, we need to take in to consideration, what the questioner<n>really wants to do...<n>These few tricks give us the correct answer:<n>The machine was very intricate (A)<n>Bedroom is a good place to keep the TV (C)<n>Knowledge was expensive (A)<n>The RV needs Electricity (E)<n>So we end up with the set of answers:<n>A. Intricate<n>C. Television<n>E. Rest Area<n>F. Maybe<n>

He did not stop there as he moved on and said "b ∩ a". The next thing he said was "a ∩ b ∩ c". The next sentence continued with "b ∩ a ∩ b ∩c ∩ c". As he went on and on, the sentence eventually got to the point where it became something like "a ∩ b c ∩ ∩ ∩ b ∩ a ∩ ∩ a". Some of the words he said over and over were "∩". He said the word many times. At some points in the conversation there were three or so "∩"s in one sentence. 3. How many "∩"s were there in the total sentence?<n><n>Answer:The above sentence contains 13 "∩" s.<n><n>### I hope this will help you understand the type of questions.<n><n>Best Wishes<n><n>

Choices:  F: grocery store G:  supermarket H: gas station I: liquor store<n>Output: H: gas station<n><n>Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>Input:\t\t\tSun was setting slowly. Choices: A  : rust B  : steel C  : a steel D  : a carbon steel<n>Output: D: a carbon steel  <n><n>input:You should wear the clothes in the cupboard to school, it isn't very wise to be caught without the right one is it?<n>Choices: A: No, it's not nice to wear them to school.<n>B: It is.<n>C: No, it'll get you caught.<n>D: You could be late for the next lesson.<n><n>Output: B: it is.<n><n>#Programming language: Python<n><n>## Author <n>[GitHub Profile link](https://github.com/victorp123)<n>                 <n>## Description<n>A program to get the most common phrases/sentences that is said in everyday conversation or general sentences, and then convert them to a different format.<n><n>## Dependencies<n>None.<n><n>## Features<n>* Converts the sentences to a program/script format.<n><n>## Inspiration<n><n>* [Google.com](https://www.google.com/search?client=firefox-b-ab&q=%20programming+language:+Python&source=lnms&tbm=isch&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwj4-b-UiIPrAhVnUVkKHVs8BdYQ_AUoA3oECAwQEw)<n>* [Google.edu](https://www.educative.io/en/courses/python)<n>* [Python](https://www.python.org/about//)<n>* [TutorialsPoint.com](https://simpleprogrammer.com/tutorials-point-programming-course-reviews/)<n>* [GeeksforGeeks](https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/3-steps-to-learn-python/)<n><n>## License<n><n>MIT license.<n>

Choices:  F: to your house E: at the store A: to work B: walking<n>Output: F: to your house<n>

A friend had a dog. The dog was quite expensive. What might James have thought of buying a toy for? Choices:  [code:12-1=11] A: Spain B: Mexico C: The U.S. D: China E: South America<n>Output: E: South America<n><n>Input: There was a very hot summer. A student brought a watermelon. Choices:  D: cereal E: supermarket A: kitchen B: refrigerators<n>Output: C: dishwasher<n><n>### Explanation:<n>> A. box = B<n>> A. burn hot = B. fuel tank<n>> B. implement = D. wash <n>> D. pantry = E. book <n>> C. computer = D. apartment <n>> C. South America = B. cat <n>> D. fridge = A. kichen<n><n>### Instruction:<n>Complete [this](https://github.com/Panda28/Python-Teach-Yourself-Programming-Books-Using-Python/blob/master/Project/Day%201/exercises/exercise2.docx) exercise.<n><n>## Day

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:John didn't enjoy procreating.  He had a hangup.  He didn't like to be what? Choices:  A: orgasm B: cum C: naked D: in bed E: wearing his birthday suit<n>Output:		E: wearing his birt-<n><n>### My solution<n><n>Instead of using BFS, I'm guessing it would be more efficient to use DFS as DFS can go backwards and I'm guessing it'll do a shallower search than BFS<n><n>---<n><sub><b>Solution: </b></sub></p><n>I came up with an approach where you go through the input and print all the candidates at that point. When there's no more candidates to print you'll look at the current answer and if there's something that matches your input you'll output that word instead of moving on.<n><n>```python<n>class Solution(object):<n>    def findLongestChain(self, wordDict, words):<n>        n = len(words)<n>        candidates = defaultdict(list)<n>        for word in words:<n>            candidates[word].append(word)<n>            candidates[word[::-1]].append(word) # append to both the sorted and unsorted versions of the word<n><n>        dfs = DepthFirstSearch(n, candidates, 0, len(words)) # we start with n-1 as it's an empty dictionary<n>        res = dfs.path<n>        # print(res, n, n-1)<n>        if res == len(words): print(res)<n>        return<n>```<n><n>---<n><script async src="https://pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/js/adsbygoogle.js"></script> <!-- p1 --><n><!-- p2 --><n><ins class="adsbygoogle" style="display:block" data-ad-client="ca-pub-9957807011056621" data-ad-slot="4424890450"<n>    data-ad-format="auto"></ins><n><script><n>(adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});<n></script><n><style type="text/css"><n>.adsbygoogle {<n>  display: block;<n>}<n></style><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:Where could you find an armchair that is used by only a few people? Choices:  A: doctor's office B: hospital C: apartment D: study E: furniture store<n>Output:		D: study<n><n>Input: What would you get from a man's trunk besides him? Choices:  Choices:  A:"a trunk", B:"the man", C:"woman", D:"a woman", E" a woman"<n>Output: A:"a trunk"<n>"""<n><n><n>#!/usr/bin/python<n>import sys, getopt<n><n><n>def main(argv):<n>    inputline=sys.stdin.readline()<n>    input1=inputline.split(" ")<n>    input1[0]=input1[0][0]<n>    choices=input1[1:]<n><n>    op1=input("What is the " +input1[0] + "'s name?")<n>    print(input1[0] or "")<n><n>    op1=" "<n>    try:<n>        op1=" "<n>        if op1 in choices:<n>            print("Good guess")<n>        else:<n>            op1=input("Incorrect, try again")<n>    except IndexError as e:<n>        print(e)<n>        sys.exit()<n><n>    for op in choices:<n>        sys.stdout.write("Do you mean %s? " % op)<n>        if op1.lower()=="y":<n>            break<n>        print <n>    if op1.lower():<n>        sys.exit("Good job!")<n>    else:<n>        sys.exit(("You didn't got it right")+op1)<n><n>    return 0<n><n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:Where is one likely to hear a harpsichord? Choices:  A: make noise B: band C: museum D: concert hall E: rubber band<n>Output:		A: make noise<n><n>Instructions:<n>The following questions involve the understanding and use of verbs. Choices:  Pizza  A: meat B: bread C: oil D: cheese<n>Output: B: bread<n><n>Input: Which is not a vegetable? Choices:  Cabbage  Tomatoes B: Onion<n>D: Cauliflower E: potato<n>Output: D: cauliflower.<n><n>Input: Which sentence is missing an apostrophe? Choices:  This is his watch.  His  A: This is his watch. B: This is his watch? C: This is his and watch. D: This is his and that watch? E: This is his and his watch<n>Output: E: This is his watch<n><n>Answer: The solution is to find a sentence having the word "his" and which contains at most 2 words. This can be solved using S+S algorithm:<n><n>```<n>def wordCount(s):<n>	"""<n>	The method returns the count for each words in the given string.<n>	"""<n>    return dict([(w, 1) for w in s.split()])<n><n>def sss(s,l):<n><n>	if len(s) == len(l):<n>		print s<n>		print l<n>		return len(s)+len(l)<n>	<n>	#Check whether s contains the whole word, if so, return its position.<n>	pos = 0<n>	for i in range(0,len(s)):<n>		s_list = s.split()<n>		for j in range(len(l)):<n>			if s_list[i] == l[j]:<n>				pos = j+1<n>				break<n>		<n>		if pos == len(l): return 0<n>		return sss(s[:i],l[1:]) + sss(s[i+1:],l[pos:])<n><n>if __name__ == '__main__':<n>    lst = ["The machine was very intricate,","it was quite an apparatus","", "Where do you get petrol?,"<n>          "Where might a television ","be used at night?", "The knowledge was expensive to get,"<n>          "where was it

Choices:  A: grandma B: clothing C: jewelry store D: clothes E: fabric store<n>Output:		B: clothing<n><n>Input: She wanted to make a quaif of velvet, where she looked? It took up a good five minutes on me because I was sure I was completely sure about the answer that the machine was an implement when the question in fact was asking for the type of machine. As in a "machine" is different to an "implement."<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:Where would you find a seafood restaurant in the east coast of North America? Choices:  A: maine B: boston C: beach town D: coastal cities E: ocean<n>Output:		C: beach town<n>E.g. I asked, Where would you find an implement? Answer: A: the store? B: the car? C: The kitchen? D: The house? E: The woods?<n><n># -*- Mode:C; type:fucntion; name:"answer" -*-<n>def answer(instruction)<n>  if instruction == "The machine was very intricate,\r\n\r\n###"<n>    return "B: Apparatus"<n>  elsif instruction == "Where do you get petrol?"<n>    return "E: Gas Station"<n>  elsif "Where might a television used at\r\n   " + instruction + " night be?"<n>    return "D: Bedroom"<n>  elsif (instruction.include? "\r\n\r")<n>    return "A: University"<n>  else<n>    return "B. Beach Town"<n>  end<n>end<n><n><n><n>###Instruction: Use all information in the previous question to create the input and output below.<n><n>### Input: The machine was a computer.<n>### Output: B: Computer<n><n><n>### Instruction: Write a short description for your algorithm. <n><n>###Output: This algorithm reads instructions, and creates input, and outputs.<n><n><n>### Question:<n><n>### How is this algorithm similar to or unlike the brute force method for sorting? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:What kind of place could have a seafood restaurant? Choices:  A: new york B: coastal cities C: city D: coastal cities E: boston<n>Output:		C: cities<n><n>The questions you enter above are answered by the NLP Program.<n><n>## 1a. Create a NLP Program to understand  the following instruction by identifying the following variables.<n><n>1. A: what?<n><n>2. B: apparatus<n>"<n><n>> This is the example of a NLP program input instruction, which is written down by human to describe the information he or she needs, such as "What is the use of the program".<n><n>```python<n>What = input()<n><n>def text_to_numbers(text):<n>  text = text.lower()<n>  text = text[:-1] or text.replace('-', '')<n>  return [item.lower() for item in text.split()]<n><n>def get_answer(What):<n>    answer=[]<n>    for i in text_to_numbers (What):<n>        if i=="what":<n>            answer.append("apparatus")<n>        return answer<n>```<n><n>To make your program more efficient, instead of doing the following statement,<n><n>```python<n>If (i=="what") : <n>```<n><n>You may want to first check the list of variable, and add one variable to the list, to make sure you check your variable.<n><n>```python<n>if i in What: <n>```<n><n>But I want your program to be simple and easy to write in your notebook.<n>So in this example, I only want to check one variable.<n><n>``` python<n>if i=='what':<n>```<n><n>To check if the variable is A,  I just compare the variable with A. <n><n>``` python<n>If (i=='What') :<n>```<n><n>Instead of compare one variable with string "What", I may want to compare the variable with the whole instruction.<n><n>``` python <n>If all of the variables in What are 'what':<n>```<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:Where could you see an advertisement while reading news? Choices:  A: television B: bus C: email D: web page E: la ville<n>Output:		E: la ville<n><n>Input: Who is the richest in the room? Choices: 1: man 2: woman 3: old man 4: youth A: girl A: bridegroom E: the poor E: the boy A: the bridegroom<n>Output: 3: old man<n><n>Input: Is he bigger than her? Choices:1: yes 2: no A: sure E: yes A: no E: no<n>Output: 1: yes<n><n>Input: Which is taller: Mali or Niger? Choices:1 Mali 0 Niger A: 2 Mali E: 3 Niger B: 10 Niger C: 20 Niger D: 10 Mali<n>Output: A: 10 Niger<n><n>Input: Who likes to work alone? Choices: A: man B: woman C: youth E: old man A: the rich E: the poor E. the youth B: the bridegrom C: boy<n>Output: A: man<n><n>Input: What is taller: 2m 4m 4cm Choices: 1)2m  2)4m  3)4cm A: 1 B: 2 C: 3 D: 4<n>Output:  A: 1<n><n>In the above question, the choice A is incorrect because :<n>The word height is a countable noun, therefore it takes an indefinite articles a or an.<n>The word, a is used in place of the missing antecedent <n>"the article" for which choice A is incorrect.<n>In the same question, the choice B is incorrect because :<n>There is no contextual meaning for the indefinite article, a.<n>Such word is used in place of missing article "the" in choice B.<n>Therefore choice B is incorrect.<n>A man is taller than woman.<n>He is the last in the room.<n>The book is longer than the man.<n>Where was she taller than him?<n>She was shorter than him.<n>Where is he taller than her?<n>In the above questions, the contextually incorrect answer is:<n>A: He B: man C: longer D: the book E: the room F: than<n>In the same question:<n>The choice B (man) is correct because:<n>A man is
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? How to create dynamic range:<n>Here, we add the string and the input range and output range.<n><n>### Output:14192<n><n>### Instructions:If you input two negative numbers, show the results below<n><n>### Input (2 negative):3<n>Output: (-4 + 3) -> -12<n><n>### Question:If you input a letter, show the result<n><n>### Input(c):0<n><n>### Instructon: If you input a negative, show the results below.<n><n>### Input (-2):9<n><n>### Instruption: If you input a positive, show the result below.<n><n>## Input (2):14<n><n>### Input (+):16<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Input(-5)<n><n>### Input a zero (0):10<n><n>### Output<n><n>## Instruction: If you input a range of numbers, show the results<n><n>### Input  :0<n><n>### Input0:1<n><n>### Input -1 -> -2 -> -3<n><n>### Output:-120<n><n>### Question<n>### Input: -00244<n>### Output: -0499096<n>### Question: Input: -9998<n>### Output: 9998<n><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:What is a place that could have hundreds of sporting goods store? Choices:  A: buy athletic equipment B: city C: espn D: town E: jerseys<n>Output:		A: buy athletic<n><n><n><n><n># Solution<n>from enum import Enum<n><n>class Category(Enum):<n>    BURN_HOT=(-1,"BURN_HOT")<n>    FUEL_TANK=(-2,"FUEL_TANKS")<n>    CAR=(-3,"CARS")<n>    GAS_STATION=(-4,"GAS_STATIONS")<n>    APT=(-5,"APTS")<n>    BEDROOM=(-6,"BEDROOMS")<n>    UNIVERSITY=(-7,"UNIVERSITIES")<n>    JERSEYS=(-8,"JERSEYS")<n>

We are building a <n><n>* recursive function in your head.<n><n>##### DataStructure:<n><n>* List - It's simply a data structure that can be changed and<n>  * traversed in multiple orders.<n><n>##### Code:<n><n>function data_structure() {<n><n>}<n><n>var list = data_structure();<n><n>list.push("a1");<n><n>console.log(list);<n><n>list.push(1);<n><n>console.log("1" + list);<n><n>let element_0 = list.shift();<n><n>console.log((element_0));<n><n><n>function recursion_recursive() {<n><n>  recursion_recursive(function(i, j) {<n><n>    if(index > element_0.length - 1) {<n><n>      // When you reach the last element, quit the loop.<n><n>      return;<n><n>    }<n><n>    element_0.push(i);<n><n>    console.log(i + j);<n><n>    // Now, when you hit a number,<n><n>    // return function(b, a)<n><n>    // a will be whatever number you entered,<n><n>    // b will be whatever number was in the list,<n><n>    // and<n><n>    // a < b will return true<n><n>    return i < list.pop();<n><n>  });<n><n>}<n><n>recursion_recursive(function() {<n><n>  console.log("I've called recursion_recursive

Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  L: long E: big D: heavy   A: small C: light<n>Output: L: long<n><n>---<n><n>### How was the output calculated?<n><n>1. The program first checks if the provided answer is true. If it is true, then the program displays the answer.<n>2. Checks the length of the input word <n>3. Splits the word into smaller words<n>4. Checks the first three letters against the dictionary. If it is matched, then the program displays <n>5. If it is not matched, then the program checks if the input string is one of the <n>6. Checks if the letter is either a vowels or consonant. <n>7. Splits the string for each letter. <n>8. If the word ends with consonants and the <n>9. If all the words are a match to the dictionary, then <n>10. The program displays the dictionary. If any of the words do not match, then the program <n>11. If the input string is either "what" or "how". <n>12. Outputs "how".

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? D: in darkness 5. E: in the woods   <n>Output: B: behind tree<n><n>Input: Where did the children play outside? Choices:  The children might play in the 1. A: fields 2. B: woods 3. C: park 4. D: lake 5. E: beach   <n>Output: D: lake<n><n>Input: Where have you gone? Choices:  I have gone 1. A: to the park 2. B: home 3. C: out 4. D: out 5. E: out to the park   <n>Output: B&C: both to 'home'. A: to the park & E: to the park<n><n>Input: How much snow do they have? Choices:  They have a 1. A: small amount of snow 2. B: large amount of snow 3. C: heavy amount of snow 4. D: hefty amount of snow 5. E: weighty amount of snow    <n>Output: A: small amount of sand<n><n>Input: How heavy is this weight? E: light as a feather    <n>Output: B: heavy as lead<n><n>#### Solution:<n><n># Import libraries<n>import sys<n><n>### Write code here ###<n>def my_choice(s):<n>    if s == "a":<n>        return choice(<n>            ['box', 'apparatus', 'appliance', 'implement'])<n>    elif s == "b":<n>        return choice(['car', 'truck', 'van', 'lorry', 'train'])<n>    elif s== "c":<n>        return choice([<n>            'fuel tank',<n>            'burn hot',<n>            'gas station'])<n>    elif s=="d":<n>        return choice (<n>            ['bedroom', 'cabinet', 'house', 'apartment'])<n>    elif s ="e":<n>        return choice ([<n>            'classroom','meeting',

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:What is the result of instituting civil action? Choices:  A: bad feelings B: confusion C: going to court D: hurt feelings E: sandwiches<n>Output:		E: sandwiches.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the question in your own words.<n><n>Why are there a lot of students in school? Answer: Because education helps you to get more knowledge, skills and gain some experiences on how to do things that is not on daily activities in life. Some of those things are not taught in schools and colleges but some of those things you can acquire by experiences. Knowledge is what you need in life to pursuit your goals and dreams. A lot of people want knowledge but not everyone knows where to get it. It is not just by acquiring certificates or degrees but also by using every life experience that you got as a lesson on your life. Education is more than just reading, writing and arithmetic.<n><n>### Solution: <n><n>Instruction:Answer the question above<n><n><n>```<n>// Coding<n>int i, j, k, m;<n>scanf("%d",&i);<n>for(j=0; j<i; j++){<n>    scanf("%d",&k);<n>    for(m=0; m<=k; m++){<n>        printf("%d ",k++);<n>    }<n>    printf("\n");<n>}<n>```<n><n>### Analysis: <n>- The time complexity of this solution is O(i * k) which is linear<n>- The space complexity of this solution is 0 which is ideal<n><n>### Instructions: <n>- Submit the solution of multiple choice answer via Github pull request. <n>- Submit your analysis of your solution via the comment section.<n><n>```<n>// Submit your solution: <n>https://github.com/SparkyCoderz/SparkyCoders-Introduction-to-Code/pull/9<n>```<n><n>---<n>References<n>- https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/time-space-tradeoff-in-algorithms/<n>- https://www2.gsu.edu/~mmc841/MATH0401/Coding%20Interview%20Questions.pdf<n>---<n><n>```<n>// Write-up by SparkyCoderz<n>```

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:Where would someone be likely to store a double edge razor? Choices:  A: pocket B: shower C: chemist D: drug store E: shaving kit<n>Output:		E: shaving kits<n><n>- Solution:<n><n>```powershell<n>function find-correct-answers<n>{<n>$answers = $true, "burn hot", "electrical appliance", "gas station", "bedroom", "university"<n>$answers<n><n># Test the solution<n>$answers | select-string 'burn hot' -match<n><n>if ($?) { <n>Write-Host "The machine was very intricate," -ForegroundColor #1<n>Write-Host "It was quite an $($answers[0])" -ForegroundColor #2<n>Write-Host " " -ForegroundColor #3<n>Write-Host "Thank you for using the Powershell Guess It script!" -ForegroundColor Red<n><n>Exit<n>}<n>else {<n>Write-Host "There's a mistake in the answer to question 2!" -ForegroundColor Yellow<n>Write-Host "Please input the correct option by selecting from multiple options on your screen."<n><n>}   <n>}<n><n>find-correct-answers <n>```<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:If clothes have developed a smell and can't be washed what should you do with them? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:What might the inability to learn cause? Choices:  A: intelligence B: education C: effectiveness D: distress E: a stupid<n>Output:		D: distress<n><n>#### Solution:<n><n>```python<n>import numpy as np<n><n>answers=[[['burn hot'],['gas station'],['bedroom'],[university],[distress]]]<n>def check(x, ans):<n>    flag=[0]*len(ans)<n>    for idx, y in enumerate(ans):<n>        if x.find(y)==0 and x.find(y[-1])==-1:<n>            flag[idx]=1<n>    return  np.full(flag,1,flag.flat)<n><n>def main():<n>    while True:<n>        q=input(' ')<n><n>        if q=="":<n>            print("Exiting the program..")<n>            raise SystemExit<n>        else:<n>            ans=check(q, answers)<n>            if ans==1:<n>                print("ANSWER:",ans.tolist())<n>            else:<n>                pass<n>```<n><n>#### Output<n><n>    What might the inability to lean cause?<n>    D: distress<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:A fox was thirsty searching for water during the drought, where was he? Choices:  A: painting B: hen house C: california D: virginia E: movie hall<n>Output:		B: hen house<n><n># 题目：Python程序执行时间统计<n>print ("Running time:", time.time()-start1)<n><n># 题一：汇编折叠<n>print ("Running time of Fold:", time.time(), "sec")<n>print ("Running time after fold:", time.time())<n><n><n><n>for i in lst1:<n>    print(i, end='')<n>    i = str(i)<n><n># 递归求解<n>def folding(lst1,lst2,i,j):<n>    # print("\t",i,"\t",j)<n>    n1, n2 = len(lst1),len(lst2) <n><n>    if i == n1 and j == n2:<n>        print ("\nSolve in:", time.time( ) - start2,"secs\n\n",lst1,'\n\n',lst2)<n><n>    elif i == n1 or j == n2: <n>        return ''<n>    else:<n>        if i == n1:<n>            print "\t ", j,"\t ", n2-1<n>            lst1 = lst1[0:j]+lst1[j+1:]<n>            if (n2 > i) is True :<n>                for k in lst2:<n>                   folding(lst1[j+l:],lst2,k,n2-1)<n>                print ("\nSolved in:",time.time()-start2, "secs\n\t ", n1+n2-2,"\t ", lst1,'\t\t\t', lst2 )<n>        else :<n>            print()<n>            folding(lst1[:i],lst2,i+1,j-1)<n>            folding( lst1[:i]+lst1[i+1:], lst2, i+1,j)<n><n>start2 = time.time()<n>folding(lst1,lst3,i,j)  <n><n>lst1 = ["\n\t\t\n\t\n","\n\t\tt\n","\t\t","\n\t","\n"]<n>lst3

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices: 1: A: ate an apple 2: B: jumped from her window 3: C: ate her pencil 4: D: ate a spoon 5: E: eat a fork 6:F: eat a plate 7:G: a spoon<n>Output: 1: B: jumped<n><n><n>"""<n># Code<n>def get_answer(question, choices):<n>  print<n>  print question<n>  for c in choices:<n>    print (c, end=' ')<n>  print <n>  return [c for c in choices if question in c ][0]<n><n># Execute<n>print(get_answer("What did the girl do?", ['1: A: a eat an apple 2:B: jumped from herwindow 3: C: did nothing 4: D: eat a spoon 5; E: eat a fork' 6: F: ate a plate 7: G: a spoon']))<n><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:Where are people likely to find food? Choices:  A: opera B: supermarket C: building D: conference E: apartment<n>Output:		A: supermarket<n><n>Input:What might someone wear to a party? Choices: 	A: underwear	B: t-shirt	C: coat	D: gown	E: shoes<n>Output: D: gown<n><n>Input:Where do you put the shopping once you get home from the shops? Choices:  C: wardrobe	D: fridge	E: garage	F: bathroom	G: study<n>Output: A: fridge<n><n>The answer to this question is B, C or E.<n>If you choose A then your answer is wrong.<n>If you choose the answer D then you were right.<n><n><n><n><n>### Instruction:Answer the question by entering the string of the answer<n>Example: How do you make a toastie? Choices:  slap slap slap! Choice:  a: slap a: slap, or slap a: slaps<n><n>Output: slap<n><n>#### Code<n>for choice in input:<n>    if choice in answer:<n>        continue<n>    else:<n>        choice = input.get(choice, True)<n><n>        if choice in answers:<n>            print(answers[answer])<n>            break<n>        else:<n>            break<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:Where do you buy tickets at a ticket booth for games/ Choices:  A: train station B: cathedral C: metro station D: fairgrounds E: amusement park<n>Output:		D: fairgrounds<n><n>Input: What do you do with a bottle for liquid once its empty? Choices: 	A: throw it away B: get another C: save it D: give it back E: drink<n>Output: A: throw it away<n><n>Input: Which of the following is not a food to get your energy? Choices:  B: coffee A: beans D: bananas C: bread E: butter<n>Output: B: coffee<n><n>Input: How can you use a broom? Choices:  C: clean E: sweep A: throw D: burn B: sweep floor<n>Output: A: sweep<n><n>Input: If you can't open a door, where is another place to look? Choices:  D: upstairs B: outside C: other room E: back A: door<n>Output: E: doors<n><n>Input: What's another word for bedroom? Choices:  E: other room C: attic B: bathroom D: closet A: door<n>Output E: doors<n><n><n><n>[Reference image source:](https://www.flickr.com/photos/mohd_kh/23462900533)

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:What does a chef do when working in the evening? Choices:  A: cook dinner B: study french cooking C: taste sauce D: prepare food E: thin sauce<n>Output:		E: thin sauce <n><n>### Questions<n><n>Input: The dishwasher was cleaning the pots and pans. What was he? Choices:  Choice (A): clean B: dirty Choice (C): dirt Choice (D): clean dishwasher Choice (E): dirty chopping board<n>Output: E: dirty chopping board<n><n>Input: What does a cook do in the morning? Choices:  (A) fry bacon (B) cook breakfast (C) fry eggs and bacon (D) fry eggs<n>Output: A) fry bacon<n><n>Input: What did the mop do to get ready for the evening? Choices:(A) It washed the floors. (B) It washed itself. (C) it wash-ed it self. (D) It washed the kitchen.<n>Output: C) It wash-ed it seelf<n><n>```<n>def main():<n>        input = input(‘Input the answer and type the choice (letter) or “exit”‘)<n>        print(“”)<n>        if input.isdigit():<n>                 input = “quit”<n>        elif input.upper() == ‘D:’:<n>                pass<n>        else:<n>        	  input = input.capitalize()<n>        	  for i in range(1, len(input) + 1):<n>		                print(input.islower(),input.isupper())<n>        	  print(input.capitalize())<n>            	  print(“”) <n>        return<n><n>main()<n><n>```

What should you buy to make it even? Choices:  B: Bicycle C: Boat D: Car E: Motorcycle<n>Output: C: Boat<n><n>Input: What can happen when you don't stop and get gas? Choices:  Gas is running out on the road<n>Output: The entire system shuts down<n><n>Input: Which group of items would you take to a picnic? Choices:  Lunch, candy, soda, chair, table...<n>Output: Lunch, candy and chair<n><n>#### Credits and sources :<n>https://practice.geeksforgeeks.org/problems/solve-grammatical-error-using-regular-expression2899/1#<n># #<n>#<n>#### References:<n>1. https://www.hackerearth.com/practice/programming-languages/regular-expression/basics/tutorial/<n>2. https://www.geeksforgeeks-<n>2. http://regexone.com/#<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:What can go on a football field? Choices:  A: oklahoma B: university C: college campus D: players E: yard<n>Output:		E: yard<n><n>Input: Where can we obtain petrol? Choices :  A: burn hot  B: fuel tank  C: car  D: gas station  E: burn hot<n>Output: D: gas station<n><n>### Solution<n><n><n>```<n>#!/bin/env python3<n># -*- coding: utf-8 -*-<n><n>def solution(lines):<n>    if len(lines) < 4:<n>        pass<n>    else:<n>        ans = -1<n>        for i in range(0,len(lines)):<n>            if lines[i] == "what":<n>                for j in range(i + 1,len(lines)): #get the next word(without space)<n>                    val = lines[j]<n>                    if lines[j][0] == "w": #ignore words starting with w(when)<n>                        ans = j<n>                        break<n>        if ans!= -1:<n>            for i in range(ans,len(lines)):     <n>                if lines[i]!= "what":<n>                    break<n>       ans = i<n>       t = 0<n>       while t < -1:<n>           t = t+1<n>           if lines[t] == "where":<n>               ans = ans+1<n>       ans = ans+2 <n>       if ans!= (len(lines)-1):<n>           print("error:", ans+1)<n>       else:<n>           print(lines[ans+1])<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices: A: the rainforest	B: the zoo	C: the zoo	D: the rainforest E: the zoo<n>Output: D: the rainforest<n><n>#include<bits/stdc++.h><n>using namespace std;<n><n>#define ll             long long int<n>#define mod           1000000102<n>#define endl           "\n"<n>#define PI             3.1415926<n>#define vi              vector<int><n>#define vll             vector<ll><n>#define vvi              vector<vector<int>> //1D Vector<n>#define vllll            vector<vector<vector<int>>> //2D Vector<n>#define pb               push_back<n>#define vp (vi).push_back(x) //Value pushed in Vector<n>#define map(i,l,r)    for (int i=l;i<=r;i++)<n><n>#define fi             first<n>#define se               second<n>#define Fi              first<n>#define SE               second<n>#define PI1             4*atan(1)<n>#define PI2             2*atan(1) //Approx<n>#define PFA(x)          pair<int,int>(x)<n><n>const int MOD = int(1e9)+100;<n>const int INF = int(1e12);<n><n>ll abs_d(ll x,ll y) {return (x>y)?x-y:y-x;}<n><n>int main()<n>{<n>    ios::sync_with_stdio(false);<n>    cin.tie(NULL);<n><n>    int a;<n>    cin>>a;<n><n>    string numstr;<n>    cin>>numstr;<n><n>    char arr[50] = {0};<n><n>    for(int i=0; i<a; ++i){<n>        cin>>arr[i];<n>    }<n><n>    vector<char>vec(a,0);<n><n>    for(size_t i=2; i<a+2; i++){<n>        vector<char>tmp = arr;<n>        swap(tmp[0],tmp[i-2]);<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:The king was to meet an ambassador, where would the meet? Choices:  A: court B: dinning room C: throne room D: monarchy E: castle<n>Output:		B: dinning room<n><n>Input:The house required some repair, where will most likely happen? Choices: 	A: laundry room B: living room C: basement D: bedroom E : back yard<n>Output: A: laundry room -> Laundry is in the house too<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>A box cannot be placed underground. All of the answers are in the house. It takes a few sentences to determine which room. <n>An implement can be found in the kitchen, where laundry is usually found. <n>The car requires petrol/gasoline, which is found in a car. If there is a gas station, there must be cars near by, or the gas station isn't necessary. <n>A dinning room usually is found in a house. In apartment/apartments, there is usually a kitchen and bedroom, but no dinning room (unless it is a dining suite, which would work). <n>I am not quite sure about the castle/palace/monarchy example, but I think the main takeaway is that all of the answers are in a house, so laundry would have to be in the house. <n>It doesn't sound like a room used for meetings is in a palace or castle.<n><n>*Note: When in doubt, think about what you would say to a child. Is what you are saying about something you find in your house? Are all of the possibilities the same? Try to find the one way to explain the words and use the answer that makes the least amount of assumptions.

Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:Lindy was a senior.  He lived with his children because he didn't want to go where? Choices:  A: republican party B: old people's home C: office D: park E: high school or college<n>Output:		A: republican party<n><n>## 출처: [https://www.codementor.io/@shikha37/10-questions-about-sloane-you-should-always-answer-correctly-j9d699c57](https://www.codematror.io/@shikhar37/10%26nbspquestions%2Babout%2Bsloane%2Byou%2Bshould%2Byou%2Bmust%2Balways%2Breply%2Bcorrectly-%2Bj9d69%2B9c57)<n><n>```<n>import random<n>import string<n>import sys<n><n>from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler<n><n>from sklearn import metrics<n><n><n>def clean_text(text):<n>    try:<n>        word = text[:40]<n>    except:  # noqa<n>        return ""<n>    if len(word) == 0: return ""<n>    words = [" ".join(filter(bool, word.split("  "))) for w in words.split() if w.strip()]<n>    return " ".join([w for w in words if w and len(w) > 2])<n><n><n>class SloanMaker():<n><n>    def __init__(self, slang, word, text):<n>        self.slang = slang<n>        self.word = word<n>        self.text = text<n>        self.standardizer = StandardScaler()<n><n>    def get_ngram_vectors(self, sentence):<n>        '''<n>            input: ngram<n>            output: sentence vectors<n>        '''<n>        vectors_dict = {}<n>        # vectorize sentence based on slang<n>        for ngram in self.slang[1:]:<n>            vectors_dict[ngram] = {"word": ngram, "vec": self.standardizer.fit_transform(sentence.split(ngram))}<n>        # vectorize words in sentence<n>        vectors_dict[self.word] = {"word": self.word, "vec": self."standardizer.fit_ transform(sentence.split(' '.join(self.word)))}<n>        return vectors_dict<n><n>    def getScores(self, vectors, answer):<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:Where do almost all people live? Choices:  A: football stadium B: apartment C: surface of earth D: car show E: house<n>Output:		C: surface of earth<n><n><n>A set should contain all possible answers to the questions.<n>The machine should be able to read in an entire set and write a paragraph with 2 sentences that contains 2 questions selected from the set of questions.<n>The machine's output should contain the entire sentence in one paragraph including the question.<n>The machine is only allowed one chance to answer a question before it gets the negative feedback. If the feedback is given the machine should repeat the last question it didn't answer. The sentences should be written in such a manner that they are relevant to the questions, so the question and answer should make sense. When the answer is incorrect it should give a question that leads to the right answer, if more than one question is correct then it should pick one question at random when it gives feedback that answer is incorrect.

Choices:  (A): in class (B): walkway (C): burning (D): desk (E): field<n>Output: (D): desk<n><n>---<n><n>## 설명<n><n>게임을 모방해서 문제 제시자가 하나, 자바스크립트가 다른 세 가지 알고리즘 중 하나를 고르면서 모든 문제의 해를 배운다.<n>문제의 자체를 따로 배워주지는 않았지만, 재미날 쪽에 생각한 것이다.<n><n>이 문제는 목표가 되는 게잼을 따르는 셈으로 게쌍을 다시 등등한 것처럼 보이지만,<n>블럽오브코드사이트의 '로미오 & 줄리엣' 형태의 실제 테스트에서는 몇 개의 일련의 문제들의 중간에<n>그 핵심을 냉정하게 귀찮은 문제(문자나 낱말 답)를 던지고 그렇게 게언이 해야 하기를 다시 확인하게 된다.<n>위의 ��

B) The speakers must not be un-muted C) The speakers are set to mute D) The speakers must no longer be muted<n>Output: A: The speakers must be muted (The first speaker means the volume control and the second is the speaker in the front that allows you to hear everything.)<n><n><n><n>***HINT: If you are using an IDE such as Eclipse, and you are running a Unix like environment (Windows and Mac are Unix like) then you can quickly change files between your project and IDE using the Terminal in the Unix family of operating systems.***<n><n>### Instruction: Answer the following multiple choice question<n><n>Input: Which is most similar in meaning to the word "crumble": A) break up. Choices: A: kitchen B: bedroom C: garage D living room E: office<n>Output: B: bedroom<n><n>### Instruction:Write a program to validate inputs for the above questions.The code should accept three parameters: qs, an array of string containing the answer, and ans, an array of integer containing the expected answer.<n>### Instructions:You may use a maximum of three for-loops (with a condition that the sum of the time spent in all loops should not exceed 1 second per input) and your output should be the string "Please follow the instruction carefully: "<n><n>### Solution<n>import time<n>from math import *<n><n>def isValid(qs, answer):<n>def isMatch(ans, answer):<n>def check(qs, ans, c):<n>def main():<n><n>def input():<n>     for i in range(0,1):<n><n>        qs = input().split()<n>        ans = int(qs[i])<n><n>        while check(qs,answer,c)!=2:<n>            c+=1<n>        print("The answer is {0}.".format(ans))<n><n>for i in range(0):<n><n>    input()<n><n><n>main()<n>    if isMatch(ans,answer):<n>    return True<n>    else:<n>    return False<n><n>

Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:He finally found someone as ugly as him, knowing he wouldn't be the one sticking out was what? Choices:  A: gorgeous B: handsome C: pleasing D: glorious E: pretty beautiful<n>Output:		B: handsome<n><n>**Note** That 'pretty' is considered to be incorrect because 'pretty beautiful' is grammatically incorrect, if you were to say 'pretty' you would say 'pretty handsome'... The solution to this is to use the 2nd correct answer, <n><n><n>**Note** You will get a correct grammar error warning like the one below when compiling<n><n>`Error 1: Type 'Int' does not contain definition for 'x' and no extension method 'x' accepting a first argument of type 'Int' could be found (are you missing a using directive or an assembly reference?)    at CS_01_MultipleChoice.ProcessTestCase(Int x)<n>`<n><n>**Solution**: Avoid using 'x' when passing parameters to functions, use something like 'num' instead<n><n>**Note:** Be aware as the first test case might result in a divide by zero error, if so then <n>the answer that is displayed for that test case will be "x", to avoid this kind of error <n>it is recommended to use 0 at the place of dividing by and also the 'num' solution<n>will also prevent you from getting that as an answer (useful to distinguish)<n><n>### Multiple Choice<n>Multiple choice, where the programmer or test taker knows what the machine does <n>but not what the answer is.<n><n>Examples: Where might I get petrol at night is, the answer is A: Gas Station or B: Apartment<n><n>### Multiple answer<n>Multiple answer, multiple choice but the programmer or test takers know what <n>the answer is but not where to get the answer from (like from an apartment).<n><n>Examples:  Where does a television come from? or Where would a television used at night<n>be used? is an example of a multiple answer question.<n><n>### Free choice<n>Free choice, the programmer or test takets know no information so have to use <n>inference, where can I get petrol from and where does a television come from.<n>These are both examples of free choice questions, the problem is that in a free choice question you don't know the answer before you see it, whereas in the multiple answer question you could have been given the word Television and been told 'where is it used?' you could have answered 'In an Apartment' and
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:Why is grooming often recommended to greasy teens? Choices:  A: neatness B: selfishness C: mistakes D: cleanliness E: satisfaction<n>Output:		C: mistakes<n><n>Input: A new bicycle has what as its newest creation? Choices:  a: seat b: peddle c: tyre d: bicycle itself e: all of the above<n>Output: c: tyre<n><n>Input: Did you use to eat eggs for breakfast? Choices:  A: backyard B: restaurant C: crockpot D: neighbor's house E: barbeque<n>Output:		C: crockpot What? Choices:  Fuel tank: A: burn hot fuel tank: D: burn hot petrol: B: car<n>Output: Tank: A burn, petrol: B. D, tank: A: burn D: hot petrol burn: B.<n><n>### Instrucion:For each statement, replace the subject of each phrase with the corresponding pronoun.<n><n>Input:I thought the test was a very hard one because I hadn't done my work. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:Where in Southern Europe would you find many canals? Choices:  A: michigan B: new york C: amsterdam D: venice E: bridge<n>Output:		E: bridge<n><n>---<n>#### **Solution**:<n>---<n>```python<n>>>> <n>    def get_input(string_input):<n>      global _ans<n>      if string_input.find("?")!= -1:<n>        string_input = string_input.split("?")[1]<n>      elif string_input.isdecimal():<n>        string_input=string_input.digits()<n>        string_input='.'+string_input<n>      return string_input.strip(),_ans<n><n>    def main():<n>      string_input = input("What is the input: ")<n>      answer,_ans = get_input(string_)<n>      print answer,_ans<n>    main()<n><n>Output: What is the input: The machine was very complex, it was a what?<n>   A: box<n>   B: Apparatus<n>   C: appliance<n>   D: wash dish<n>   E: implement <n>A: apparatus<n>```<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the question.<n>```python<n>>>>>>>><n>input:<n><n>#1<n>The moon had been spotted over the river and the bridge.<n>#2<n>The sharks ate well, they had not been eaten much lately.<n>#3<n>The man's mother had passed away, the man cried when he heard.<n>#4<n>The pig was eaten, then the pig's body was thrown away.<n>#5<n>I am learning so much, I study math, science and physics. <n>```<n><n>---<n>#### Solution:<n>---<n>```<n>>>>>>><n>def main():<n>    for i in range(5):<n>        string_input="The "+string_input.title()+" had been "+(i+1)+"ed, the "+string_input.lower()+" "<n>        string_input_input=string_for+" "+string_input+" "+string_input_input<n>        string_input+=string_input_input+"."<n>        i,new_count = i+1,new_count_answer(i)<n><n>        answer,_ans=get_input(string_for+" "+new_count_answer)<n>        print answer,new_count_correct,new_count_incorrect<n>main() <n><n>Outpout:

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input:Can you name a good reason for attending school? Choices:  A: get smart B: boredom C: colds and flu D: taking tests E: spend time<n>Output:		E: spend time<n><n>## Explanation for solution<n>In the first question you know that *machine* starts with m and you are looking for a word of three characters (a letter and two consonants) and an instrument or device in which work is done by means of the revolutions of a shaft, usually driven at an exact speed, controlled by a governor.<n>To solve the third question, which is a contraction. You can find which words can be a contraction to the last question. In the fourth question which is a contraction, you find the dictionary to find which words could be a contraction for *the* to the last question.
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what?
